    • getFingers

      public List<Finger> getFingers()
      The list of Finger objects detected in this frame that are attached to this hand, given in order from thumb to pinky. The list cannot be empty.
      Returns:
      The List<Finger> containing all Finger objects attached to this hand.

    • setFingers

      The Vector representing the coordinates of the palm position.

    • getPalmNormal

      public PalmNormal getPalmNormal()
      The normal vector to the palm. If your hand is flat, this vector will point downward, or “out” of the front surface of your palm. The direction is expressed as a unit vector pointing in the same direction as the palm normal (that is, a vector orthogonal to the palm). You can use the palm normal vector to compute the roll angle of the palm with respect to the horizontal plane:
      Returns:
      The Vector normal to the plane formed by the palm.

    • setPalmNormal

      public void setPalmNormal(PalmNormal palmNormal)

    • getDirection

      public Direction getDirection()
      The direction from the palm position toward the fingers. The direction is expressed as a unit vector pointing in the same direction as the directed line from the palm position to the fingers. You can use the palm direction vector to compute the pitch and yaw angles of the palm with respect to the horizontal plane:
      Returns:
      The Vector pointing from the palm position toward the fingers.

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection(Direction direction)

    • getRotation

      public Rotation getRotation()
      Returns:
      The rotation of the hand as a quaternion.

    • setRotation

      public void setRotation(Rotation rotation)

    • getGrabStrength

      public double getGrabStrength()
      Deprecated.
      Use getGrabAngle() instead
      The strength of a grab hand pose. The strength is zero for an open hand, and blends to 1.0 when a grabbing hand pose is recognized
      Returns:
      A float value in the [0..1] range representing the holding strength of the pose.

    • setGrabStrength

      public void setGrabStrength(double grabStrength)

    • getGrabAngle

      public double getGrabAngle()
      The angle between the fingers and the hand of a grab hand pose. The angle is computed by looking at the angle between the direction of the 4 fingers and the direction of the hand. Thumb is not considered when computing the angle. The angle is 0 radian for an open hand, and reaches pi radians when the pose is a tight fist.
      Returns:
      The angle of a grab hand pose between 0 and pi radians (0 and 180 degrees).

    • setGrabAngle

      public void setGrabAngle(double grabAngle)

    • getPinchStrength

      public double getPinchStrength()
      Deprecated.
      Use getPinchDistance() instead.
      The holding strength of a pinch hand pose. The strength is zero for an open hand, and blends to 1.0 when a pinching hand pose is recognized. Pinching can be done between the thumb and any other finger of the same hand.
      Returns:
      A float value in the [0..1] range representing the holding strength of the pinch pose.
      Since:
      2.0

    • setPinchStrength

      public void setPinchStrength(double pinchStrength)

    • getPinchDistance

      public double getPinchDistance()
      The distance between the thumb and index finger of a pinch hand pose. The distance is computed by looking at the shortest distance between the last 2 phalanges of the thumb and those of the index finger. This pinch measurement only takes thumb and index finger into account.
      Returns:
      The distance between the thumb and index finger of a pinch hand pose in millimeters.

    • setPinchDistance

      public void setPinchDistance(double pinchDistance)

    • getPalmWidth

      public double getPalmWidth()
      The estimated width of the palm when the hand is in a flat position.
      Returns:
      The width of the palm in millimeters

    • setPalmWidth

      public void setPalmWidth(double palmWidth)

    • getStabilizedPalmPosition

      public StabilizedPalmPosition getStabilizedPalmPosition()
      The stabilized palm position of this Hand. Smoothing and stabilization is performed in order to make this value more suitable for interaction with 2D content. The stabilized position lags behind the palm position by a variable amount, depending primarily on the speed of movement.
      Returns:
      A modified palm position of this Hand object with some additional smoothing and stabilization applied.

    • setStabilizedPalmPosition

      public void setStabilizedPalmPosition(StabilizedPalmPosition stabilizedPalmPosition)

    • getWristPosition

      public WristPosition getWristPosition()
      The position of the wrist of this hand.
      Returns:
      A vector containing the coordinates of the wrist position in millimeters.

    • setWristPosition

      public void setWristPosition(WristPosition wristPosition)

    • getTimeVisible

      public double getTimeVisible()
      The duration of time this Hand has been visible to the Leap Motion Controller.
      Returns:
      The duration (in seconds) that this Hand has been tracked.

    • setTimeVisible

      public void setTimeVisible(double timeVisible)

    • getConfidence

      public double getConfidence()
      How confident we are with a given hand pose.
      Returns:
      confidence level ranges between 0.0 and 1.0 inclusive.

    • setConfidence

      public void setConfidence(double confidence)

    • getIsLeft

      public Boolean getIsLeft()
      Identifies whether this Hand is a left hand.
      Returns:
      True if the hand is identified as a left hand.

    • setIsLeft

      public void setIsLeft(Boolean isLeft)

    • getArm

      public Arm getArm()
      The arm to which this hand is attached. If the arm is not completely in view, Arm attributes are estimated based on the attributes of entities that are in view combined with typical human anatomy.
      Returns:
      The Arm object for this hand.

    • setArm

      public void setArm(Arm arm)
